page.title: 09Superstitions,Bradford 1985
page.content: 1.Don't walk under a{ladder}that is leaning against the wall.That's bad luck.2.My mum shouts at us if we put {shoes on the table.}3.We don't like {Friday to fall on the 13th.}That is an unlucky day.4.My dad wouldn't have a {green car}even if he was given one.5.When we go for a drive in the country we like to meet a{load of} {hay.}That's good luck.6.If one of your {eyelashes}falls out,put it on the palm of your hand and blow it gently,then wish and it will come true.7.On our birthday we put a{candle}for each year of our life.At our party we light the candles and try to blow them out all with one breath.Then we wish and it will come true.8.It is lucky to see a {black cat or a white horse.}9.When there is a{New Moon}I turn my money over in my pocket.Then I'll have enough money until the next New Moon.
